events.message: The policyholder reported a vehicle collision that occurred at an intersection, requesting to file an official claim for the damages caused to the car.
The claim was reviewed and categorized under Auto Accident due to keywords indicating a car accident, ensuring proper processing in the claims department.
An insurance agent specialized in automobile claims was assigned promptly to handle the case and assist the customer with the next steps.
The insurance company officially acknowledged receipt of the auto accident claim and confirmed the beginning of the claims process for the policyholder.
The agent requested the customer to provide photographs of the vehicle damage, police accident report, and any witness statements relating to the collision.
The customer submitted the requested photos, official accident report, and contact details of witnesses for the vehicle accident claim.
An investigation into the circumstances surrounding the vehicle collision was initiated to verify the details and assess liability.
The investigation concluded confirming the collision was caused by another driver, supporting the customer's claim for damages.
A fair monetary settlement amount was proposed to the policyholder based on the damage assessment and coverage terms.
The policyholder expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and appreciated the timely communication and support throughout.
The claim was formally approved by the insurance company, confirming that the settlement offer was accepted and the process would proceed to payment.
Payment covering the repair costs for the vehicle was issued and sent to the policyholder's bank account as agreed.
The auto accident claim was officially closed after full settlement and payment issuance, concluding the matter successfully.
All files and documents related to the auto accident claim were securely archived for future reference and compliance purposes.
